Tucson turns to Kup. He too, could sense something a miss.

" You're right =
Kup, something is disturbing about Windlord...  It seems that perhaps some =
Predacon programming may have remained there residually..  Hopefully Stanto=
n and Bump will be able to convince him to have another scan done of his lo=
gic circuitry, just to be on the safe side.  No doubt that Hydras has impac=
ted us all, especially those who have been infected by that Predacon shell =
program."

He tightens his fist.

" That is why perhaps it's wise that I co=
nfront him one on one.  He has not infected me but has struck at Rodimus, W=
indlord and Nightlight.  For their saftey, I take the burden of dealing wit=
h Hydras personally."

Straight Shot, Uproar, Quickstride, and Rat Trap nea=
rly fall out of their seats with eyes wide with shock. Straight Shot is the=
 first to speak up.

"ARE YOU NUTS?!  YOU CAN'T DO THAT HE'LL KILL YOU!"

Q=
uickstride chimes in next.

"Yeah, that's like whoah, seriously not a very =
good decision sir..  Very generous but wow, that could really be messy."

R=
at Trap looks to Tucson.

"Wheels, ya can't, ya just can't do that.  You go=
t a great bunch of bots, like ya said, please ya gotta accept help this tim=
e."

Tucson looks to everyone.

" I know you have all expressed concern ove=
r my actions, when it comes to Hydras, and I fully understand why you are s=
o concerned.  Hydras needs to be stopped, but I can not expect any of you t=
o become vulnerable to his attack, when it is I who should be doing somethi=
ng about him personally.  Rodimus, I owe it to you to avenge what he has do=
ne to you, Nightlight and Windlord, soley due to the fact that when you nee=
ded me years ago, I did not come through for you.  Now, I have to redeem my=
self for that costly mistake, and amend the wrongs which have been set upon=
 you."

Uproar looks to Tucson.

" But, that wasn't your fault.  I read up =
on it, you didn't do anything wrong, you were out there going above and bey=
ond the call of duty and you were unexpectedly hit from behind.  There was =
no way you could have avoided what happened to you.  Although, we don't kno=
w who did it do we?  That wasn't in the intel I read.  Guys, We can't let T=
ucson face Hydras all alone, it's way too dangerous."

Straight Shot looks =
to Leo Prime and everyone else.

"Leo Prime,everyone, I believe I know how =
ta fill in the gaps as to what happened vorns ago.  I was with him during t=
hat battle.  He had finished dealing with some of the heavy hitting battlec=
hargers, when he noticed that Rodimus and the others were getting seriously=
 pegged out in battle.  He couldn't just sit there and watch it happen, and=
 he knew that decoy detail wasn't best suited for his alt form which at the=
 time, was more designed for utility and off road driving.  But he couldn't=
 bare to see anyone suffer or be oppressed so he did the unthinkable, and b=
eyond his ability specifications, he sped out there to catch the attentions=
 of the Seekers, who were concentrating on striking at the Autobot speedste=
rs.  Well, Tucson got their attention and began to draw them away from Rodi=
mus and the others, but then, un be known to him, way out in the distance, =
Cyclonus hid himself nicely among cloud cover, and decided to take a pop sh=
ot at Tucson.  Well, I saw out of the rear view, Cyclonus in the distance, =
and then I saw the shot coming toward us.  After that, Tucson and I were st=
ruck, but I was the only one who saw the shot and the perpetrator.  Then, a=
nything after the strike, I really don't remember."

Night Shift now hobble=
s into the room slowly.

" I do.  I - was there too.  I could see Cyclonus =
headn' toward 'em, but I was so far off fightn' some of the combaticons, I =
couldn't get there fast enough ta swing Tucson or Straight Shot outa the wa=
y.  I was miles behind them  and no matter how loud I beeped my horn ta war=
n 'em, they couldn't hear me.  Then, yeah, I saw that slag ball hit my budd=
y, and there was an explosion that went miles up in the sky.. I thought for=
 sure he was a gonner..  I did my best ta get back up, and then got Tucson =
back ta base..  He was off line for a long time, and when he woke up, he th=
ought the power went out..  Little did he know he was struck blind by Cyclo=
nus, never ta see the light of day again, or at least until he got a second=
 opinion from a medic."

Straight Shot knew that Talon would also like to s=
ee Tucson get his sight back.  She smiles to Talon and puts a hand on hers.=


" I think Talon said it best, when she said it was time we gave Tucson ba=
ck his eyes.  Leo Prime, before anything else, I think it's time you guys f=
ought as a whole, and you really can't do that unless all of you can see th=
e road ahead of you.  So, if I may do so, I want to request that Tucson Pri=
me undergoes a detailed examination and full repair of his visual impairmen=
t."

Tucson looks to Straight Shot and Talon.

"They're right.  It's time I=
 stopped procrastinating.  Stanton, Bump, I would like to give you two the =
honor of undergoing this proceedure.  I've seen your work, and I would be h=
onored if you would perform the repairs."

He looks to everyone confidently=
.

" We will do this, we will overcome every obsticle they've put in front =
of us.  But we must work as a team if we're to achieve success."
